snippet: Climate change has forced arena managers in the northernmost reaches of Canada to forgo relying on natural ice for the entire skating season.
abstract: Climate change has forced hockey arena managers in the northernmost reaches of Canada to forgo relying on natural ice for the entire skating season; 9 of 14 villages in Nunavik, Quebec, have installed cooling systems at community areas within the last five years.
lead_paragraph: Climate change has forced arena managers in the northernmost reaches of Canada to forgo relying on natural ice for the entire skating season.

headline.seo: More Rinks in Far North Find Need for Cooling Systems
headline.main: Rinks in Canada’s Arctic Turn to Cooling Systems
headline.print_headline: Rinks in Canada’s Arctic Turn to Cooling Systems
